title: SIGSEGV upon startup in version 2.40.1 and 2.40.0 (x86 version)
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2.40.1-stable`

OS & Version: Ubuntu 22.04 (x86)

Commit hash: Binary downloaded from https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/releases/download/v2.40.1/erigon_2.40.1_linux_amd64.tar.gz,  https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/releases/download/v2.40.0/erigon_2.40.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz and https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/releases/download/v2.39.0/erigon_2.39.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz

Erigon Command (with flags/config):

```
erigon \
 --chain bor-mainnet \
 --torrent.download.rate 1gb \
 --datadir /data/erigon \
 --private.api.addr 127.0.0.1:9090 \
 --authrpc.addr 127.0.0.1 \
 --http.addr 0.0.0.0 \
 --http.port 8545 \
 --http.vhosts "*" \
 --http.corsdomain "*" \
 --metrics \
 --http.api "eth,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon" \
 --ws \
 --bor.heimdall http://127.0.0.1:1317 \
 --maxpeers 20
```

Chain/Network: Polygon

#### Expected behaviour

Starts OK

#### Actual behaviour

SIGSEGV error and crashes

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Start erigon. data folder is empty and permission is fine. Tested on both Intel and AMD CPUs.

FYI:
[ARM version](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/releases/download/v2.40.1/erigon_2.40.1_linux_arm64.tar.gz) - works OK

[x86 2.31.0 version](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/releases/download/v2.31.0/erigon_2.31.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz) - works OK


#### Backtrace

````

WARN[03-18|01:10:02.372] no log dir set, console logging only
INFO[03-18|01:10:02.372] Starting metrics server                  addr=http://127.0.0.1:6060/debug/metrics/prometheus
````

See whole backtrace here: [backtrace.txt](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/11007170/backtrace.txt)

```
sudo erigon \
 --chain bor-mainnet \
 --torrent.download.rate 1gb \
 --datadir /data/erigon \
 --private.api.addr 127.0.0.1:9090 \
 --authrpc.addr 127.0.0.1 \
 --http.addr 0.0.0.0 \
 --http.port 8545 \
 --http.vhosts "*" \
 --http.corsdomain "*" \
 --metrics \
 --http.api "eth,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon" \
 --ws \
 --bor.heimdall http://127.0.0.1:1317 \
 --maxpeers 20 \
 —-downloader.verify
```

Same result:

```

[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x2 addr=0x7f84067fd072 pc=0x6e8343806a7f]
```
Having exact same issues but running for Ethereum mainnet.

Turns out it was already fixed if compiled binary from latest devel branch instead of using a precompiled release. :)

Haven't tried with polygon so not sure if it would work for OP too.

Can confirm for v2.41, as well. The pre-compiled binary release failed with the same errors; running the binary compiled from source works fine.

Ubuntu 22.04
go 1.20.2
